intro: Cryptocarya bhutanica, commonly known as Bhutanian cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the eastern Himalayas, primarily found in Bhutan and parts of India. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. The fruit is a small, dark-colored drupe, which contains a single seed and is an important food source for various forest birds and mammals.
